channel.title: Squarespace Help such as Centering Logo and Reducing Spaces
channel.description: [quote] Hi! I run a small web design company using Squarespace templates and found you when looking for Squarespace specialists. I am looking for a developer who can help me institute features that aren't standard on Squarespace templates. For example, 2 things I'd like help with are: + How to center the logo in the Bedford template, with page links on either side, like the Pacific Template . +How to reduce spaces between images, so they can be closer together, like the social media icons attached below. (The first image is the site, and the second is how I'd like the social media icons arranged. Squarespace automatically pads the images so you can't get them closer to each other and I need to find a way around this.) Are you available to take on this kind of work? Ideally, it would be a working relationship where I could use your development expertise, and occasionally even refer you clients for more complicated projects. Thank you so much and hope to hear from you! Courtney [/quote]

item.title: Squarespace Help such as Centering Logo and Reducing Spaces
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Hey Courtney, thanks for getting in touch! I'm sure available for this kind of work and specially the more complicated ones. If you haven't, please do read www.cregox.com/your-home

I'm not sure what you mean by "page links on either side". On Pacific I can see just page links centered right below the logo:

That is something quite simple to do. Maybe as simple as this (works in my end):

h1.site-title {
  display: table-caption;
  text-align: center;
  width: inherit;
}
#desktopNav ul {
  text-align: center;
}

But if you mean something like what happens on some Fulton sites, for instance:

Then it can be very tricky, but certainly still possible. Anything that's just tweaking the layout like this (as opposed as to adding elements) is possible.

And so, as for "reducing spaces between images", it would probably be something also as simple as tweaking on the CSS. For instance, maybe something like this could help (it would work on my site):

nav.sqs-svg-icon--list {
  a.sqs-svg-icon--wrapper {
    margin-right: 1em !important;
  }
}
